resources:
Docutain SDK Example Document Scanner Starts the document scanner which provides automatic scanning of paper documents. Data Extraction Extract data, e.g. invoice data, from a previously scanned or imported (PDF or Image) document. Text Recognition (OCR) Run OCR on the previously scanned or imported (PDF or Image) document and get the recognized text. Generate PDF Document Generate a searchable (includes recognized text) PDF document out of the scanned pages or imported image. First, scan or import a document Configure color, scanner and editing of the SDK Settings Document Scan PDF Import Image Import Name 1 Name 2 Name 3 Zipcode City Street Phone Customer ID BIC IBAN Date Amount Invoice ID Reference Payment State Color Settings Scan Settings Edit Settings Reset
// color settings ColorPrimary Used to tint progress indicators and the dialog buttons
ColorSecondary Used to tint selectable controls and the capture button
ColorOnSecondary Used to tint elements that reside on ColorSecondary, like the icon of the capture
ColorScanButtonsLayoutBackground Used to tint the background of the layout containing the buttons of the scan layout, like the capture button or torch button
ColorScanButtonsForeground Used to tint the foreground of the buttons of the scan layout, like the torch button
ColorScanPolygon Used to tint the polygon overlay which highlights the currently detected document
ColorBottomBarBackground Used to tint the bottom toolbar background of the image editing page
ColorBottomBarForeground Used to tint the buttons within the bottom toolbar of the image editing page
ColorTopBarBackground Used to tint the top toolbar background
ColorTopBarForeground Used to tint the elements contained in the top toolbar, like buttons and titles
// scan settings AllowCaptureModeSetting If activated, the document scanner toolbar will display an item that allows the user to switch between automatic and manual camera triggering
AutoCapture If activated, the camera will capture the image automatically at the right moment
AutoCrop If activated, image gets automatically cropped if document was detected. This applies only when importing
MultiPage If activated, scanning multi page documents is possible. Set this to false if you need to scan single page documents
PreCaptureFocus If activated, the camera will run a focus action right before taking the image, This improves the quality of the scanned images, but depending on the device, image capture might take a little bit longer. This applies only to Android
DefaultScanFilter The default scan filter that will be used after scan
// edit settings AllowPageFilter If deactivated, the bottom toolbar will hide the filter page item
AllowPageRotation If deactivated, the bottom toolbar will hide the rotate page item
AllowPageArrangement If deactivated, the bottom toolbar will hide the arrange page item
AllowPageCropping If deactivated, the bottom toolbar will hide the page cropping item
PageArrangementShowDeleteButton If activated, each item of the page arrangement functionality will show a delete button
PageArrangementShowPageNumber If activated, each item of the page arrangement functionality will show it#s page number
